body: ~~@ellisonbg Maybe we should just remove the tab index from the auto completer and tooltip...  That way they don't actually steal focus.  Then we could send keys to them manually using the keyboard manager.~~
~~Even this workaround doesn't seem to work. hmmm~~
~~Ok, now this is a working workaround...~~
~~I should mention, the side effects of this workaround are that the cell appears to enter a command mode state when the completer is up.  The same effect doesn't exist with the tooltip.~~

This workaround has evolved into a fix.  Instead of ignoring the blur event raised by codemirror, the blur event is acknowledged under all circumstances and the cell enters command mode.  This isn't a problem with the tooltip because it is never actually focused.  For the auto completer this was a problem, the workaround is to tell the cell to render itself as if it is in edit mode, event though it actually is not.  When the completer is hidden, the cell is returned to command mode.  If the cell editor is refocused (most often automatically after the completer is hidden) the cell naturally enters edit mode again.
Thanks, Jon, taking a look at how it works...
When I open a tooltip and then click on another cell (its CM area), the tooltip stays open.

> When I open a tooltip and then click on another cell (its CM area), the tooltip stays open.

Thanks for reporting this, should be fixed now.

Travis choked on 

```
Test file: /home/travis/virtualenv/python3.3/lib/python3.3/site-packages/IPython/html/tests/notebook/tooltip.js
No output has been received in the last 10 minutes, this potentially indicates a stalled build or something wrong with the build itself.
```

So I kicked him.

> So I kicked him.

Sounds like assault :police_car:  @angrypaul
This is passing on Travis, does anybody else want to review this?  Participants @ellisonbg or @ivanov ?

yes, i was looking into it yesterday - was going to try to send you a patch but haven't gotten that far. Your PR  fixes the functionality, but the Edit Mode indicator dissappears during completion (though the cell stays in edit mode)

>  but the Edit Mode indicator dissappears during completion (though the cell stays in edit mode)

Ah good catch!  I must have been so busy looking at the cell I didn't notice the little icon way up there in the corner.  I'll keep my eye open for the patch (I'm guessing you'll open a PR against this branch?)

> I'll keep my eye open for the patch (I'm guessing you'll open a PR against this branch?)

I haven't gotten that far, was just trying to wrap my head around
all of the moving parts here, first.

I have tested this interactively and reviewed the code. Just a few inline comments are needed and then it is ready for merge. We might want to add some tests for these cases as well. Should that be done in a separate PR after your testing one is in? Should we merge that first and have you rebase this one?

> Should we merge that first and have you rebase this one?

I prefer that

> Just a few inline comments are needed and then it is ready for merge

I added the comments, I think we are still waiting on a fix from @ivanov for the kb status icon indicator ...  Unless he wants to submit that in a separate PR?

I went ahead and added a fix for the status indicator.  It was a small change, I just manually fire the edit_mode and command_mode events of the notebook.   When the completer is replaced with codemirror's built in completer, we won't have to deal with this foolery.
now i'm popping out of edit mode. Steps to reproduce: `a<tab>b<tab>` - this completes to `abs` but also enters command mode.
and another related one: `(<tab><tab>` leaves edit mode (the first tab makes a competer drop down, the second one makes it go away and switches to command mode)
hmmm I wonder if that's related to raising of the events... Looking

Hmm, I just tested the two issues that @ivanov reported on FF and Chrome (OS X) and can't reproduce them. Obviously, that doesn't mean these aren't problems, just that I can't debug them on my current setup. Just to be sure @ivanov can you pull the latest from this brach, clean cache and retry? I will sit down with @jdfreder this afternoon and look at this one though.
I think this code is ready for merging, we just need to track down the other two problems.
The two bugs @ivanov mentioned should be fixed now
I tested the last changes on FF+Chrome OS X and they work fine. @ivanov can you test?
so the behavior change i'm seeing now is that `a<tab>b<tab>` does not complete to `abs`, the way it does in master.
I can confirm what @ivanov is seeing - this PR (as of c1aa237) breaks completion that works in master.

further case: `a<tab>bs` (i.e. finishing typing out the completion by hand) will leave edit mode for the cell (no green border, pencil edit mode icon removed), but I am still able to type things in the cell.

hmmm...  I wonder if there is a way to easily make our code completer behave like an extension of codemirror...  If that were the case I don't think we would have to monkey with any of this fake-edit mode business.  I'm looking at their API right now.

> hmmm... I wonder if there is a way to easily make our code completer behave like an extension of codemirror

Yes, there absolutely is. But it's complicated and we decided against doing it for 2.0 (#4988).
